snippet: A music critic sits down at some of the 88 Sing for Hope decorated pianos placed outdoors throughout the city, and finds the incongruity of it all special.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini Critic's Notebook discusses initiative Sing for Hope, which decorated and placed 88 pianos outdoors throughout New York City; nonprofit arts group plans to move all pianos to Josie Roberston Plaza in Lincoln Center for day of outdoor concerts before they are donated to schools, hospitals and community centers.
lead_paragraph: A music critic sits down at some of the 88 Sing for Hope decorated pianos placed outdoors throughout the city, and finds the incongruity of it all special.

headline.seo: The Sing for Hope Pianos Project
headline.main: 88 Spots to Tickle Keys and Your Fancy
headline.print_headline: 88 Spots to Tickle Keys and Your Fancy
